FuncDef:
The radius-attribute-format nas-port-id unitary-subslot command sets the sub-card type in the subslot field of the NAS-Port-Id attribute.
The undo radius-attribute-format nas-port-id unitary-subslot command cancels the default setting.
By default, the sub-card type is not set in the subslot field of the NAS-Port-Id attribute.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of interfaces on the subcard.
The value ranges from 1 to 24.

Specifies the slot ID of the interface board.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the radius-attribute-format nas-port-id unitary-subslot command is used, the slot number, sub-slot number, and interface number in the format use the code of the single sub-card. For example, if the original code of the board with a sub-board is ETH 1/0/0 to ETH 1/0/3 and ETH 2/0/0 to ETH 2/0/3, after the command is used, the code is converted into ETH 1/0/0 to ETH 1/0/6.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
